Interested in my work?

Click on the images to learn more about each project!

TARTANHACKS REGISTRATION SYSTEM

This is the registration system for TartanHacks, Carnegie Mellon's largest hackathon. The registration system was created using Mongo, Express, Angular, and Node by former ScottyLabs members, which I currently help update and bug fix along with other members on the registration team.

SPORSHMALLOW

Sporshmallow is a 2D, two player fighting game in which marshmallow-like characters combat each other. Players can choose between a tennis player (long range) or a karate player (short range). Made in Unity using C# with my friends Gustavo Silvera and Bella Laybourn.

LUNA

Luna is a period information web application meant to help women relieve their symptoms. This was a project I worked on during Kode with Klossy with Jevina Wong and Hilary Zen. We only had a day to create it (completely from scratch using HTML, CSS, and Ruby).

ENVIRONMENTALIST

EnvironmentaList is an environmental information website. The main page focuses on information about countries' carbon emissions, while other pages give information on how to make a personal positive impact on the environment. This website was made as a part of Kode with Klossy with Daniela Zarate and Danielle Rabiner. It was made in a day using only vanilla HTML, CSS, and Javascript. The technical focus of this project was to learn about responsive design without the use of frameworks.

TEENHACKS LI

Teenhacks LI is a hackathon I'm currently helping organize. With the help of my friend, Jeffrey Yu, I made the website that acts as an information page for the hackathon. This website was created using Bootstrap. It was fun learning a CSS framework for the first time!

SILENT VOICE

Silent Voice is a s a text-based game intended to bring awareness to the effects of bullying. With the help of my friend, Jeffrey Yu, (again) I made this interactive story through a program called Twine. This project made me truly appreciate the authors that create "choose your own adventure" stories; there were so many different storylines to write!

TOTORO JUMP

Totoro Jump is a knock-off of the classic Doodle Jump. This was a project I worked on during my first ever hackathon, CodeDay NY. At the time, I knew little to no code, so I used Construct 2 for this project and followed a beginner tutorial.

PINEAPPLE SMASH

Pineapple Smash is a basic idle-clicker game. This was a project I worked on during a competition in code club with my friend Sam Miller. This project was the first time I ever used JavaScript.

HIGH SCHOOL SURVIVAL GUIDE

This is a guide I made for people entering Roslyn High School. Though this isn't a coding related project, I wanted to put together a list of all the things I wish I knew before high school. I spent a long time compiling this, and I hope it's useful for someone!
